intro: Parodia salmonea var. lau-multicostata, commonly known as the Orange Ghost Cactus, is a unique cactus species native to the arid regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical, ribbed stems that are typically green with a distinctive orange or red hue, especially when exposed to sunlight. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pink flowers during the warmer months, adding a striking visual contrast to its foliage. It is a slow-growing species that thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it ideal for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Its compact size and vibrant coloration make it a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
